meanings.definition: Calculate the average of a set of numbers.
meanings.sent1: She is averaging the test scores of her students.
meanings.sent2: I am averaging the monthly expenses to create a budget.
meanings.sent3: The computer made a mistake while averaging the grades, giving everyone a perfect score.
meanings.sent4: His cooking skills are averaging out to be quite impressive.
meanings.sent5: Averaging the rainfall over the year helps farmers plan their crops effectively.

meanings.definition: To have or show a particular average.
meanings.sent1: The team is averaging a high score in every game.
meanings.sent2: The company is averaging a profit increase of 10% each quarter.
meanings.sent3: The cat is averaging a nap time of 3 hours a day.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork is averaging a price much higher than expected.
meanings.sent5: Averaging a consistent speed during the race helped him win first place.
